intro: Tragia glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth tragia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are usually smooth and elliptical in shape. Tragia glabrescens is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes, though its botanical properties are not extensively studied.
